src:
Diccionario millenial: ¿Qué significa #TBT, BAE y otro términos?
Si tienes algunas dudas del lenguaje actual, entonces debes de echar un vistazo a este diccionario millenial.
04 Nov 2019, 13:05 by Jimena Ripalda























Muchas veces hemos visto, o escuchado, abreviaciones que se nos hicieron conocidas pero no logramos saber cuál es su significado.
Por eso, hoy te contaremos cuáles son los términos más populares entre los millenials y cuáles son sus significados.




BAE

Esta palabra proviene de la frase en inglés 'before anyone else' que significa “antes que nadie” y da a entender que esa persona está en primer lugar.

OTP

Las siglas provienen de la palabra ‘One True Pairing’ que se puede interpretar que eres su pareja ideal.
 DIY
Este es uno de los términos que ha ganado más popularidad y proviene de la frase ‘Do It Yourself’ que significa ‘Hazlo tú mismo’.

TBT

‘Throwback Thursday’ es uno de los términos más populares que se usan con un hashtag para publicar recuerdos felices.




LIT

Este término es para aprobar algo o resaltar una buena experiencia.

TLDR

Tiene dos versiones pero significan lo mismo, ‘too long; didn't read’ o ‘too lazy; didn't read'. Ambos denotan que ignorarán el mensaje porque es muy largo.

Te puede interesar
text:
Millennial Dictionary: What does #TBT, BAE and other terms mean?
If you have any doubts about the current language, then you should take a look at this millennial dictionary.
04 Nov 2019, 13:05 by Jimena Ripalda























Many times we have seen, or heard, abbreviations that became known to us but we do not know what their meaning is.
Therefore, today we will tell you what are the most popular terms among millennials and what their meanings are.




BAE

This word comes from the English phrase 'before anyone else' which means "before anyone else" and implies that this person is in the first place.

OTP

The acronym comes from the word ‘One True Pairing’ which can be interpreted as your ideal match.
DIY
This is one of the terms that has gained more popularity and comes from the phrase ‘Do It Yourself’ which means ‘Do it yourself’.

TBT

‘Throwback Thursday’ is one of the most popular terms used with a hashtag to post happy memories.




LIT

This term is to approve something or highlight a good experience.

TLDR

It has two versions but they mean the same thing, ‘too long; didn't read ’or‘ too lazy; didn't read '. Both denote that they will ignore the message because it is very long.

It may interest you
